BR_text.BRsummary: No response after starting the server
BR_text.BRdescription:
I got the following RuntimeWarning after starting the server by ./digits-devserver, and then there is no response. The thread is in uninterruptible sleep state.
 <denchmark-code>/home/ubuntu/anaconda/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools-18.3.2-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources/__init__.py:203: RuntimeWarning: You have iterated over the result of pkg_resources.parse_version. This is a legacy behavior which is inconsistent with the new version class introduced in setuptools 8.0. In most cases, conversion to a tuple is unnecessary. For comparison of versions, sort the Version instances directly. If you have another use case requiring the tuple, please file a bug with the setuptools project describing that need.
 
 Saved config to /home/ubuntu/DIGITS/digits/digits.cfg
 </denchmark-code>

comments_0.comment_text:
Whoops, I'm sure that has to do with <denchmark-link:https://github.com/NVIDIA/DIGITS/pull/336>#336</denchmark-link>
 . I'm investigating now.
 What version of setuptools do you have, exactly?
 $ pip list | grep setuptools
 setuptools (7.0)

comments_1.comment_text: When I upgrade to the latest version of setuptools, I get that same warning, but the server and testsuite both still work just fine.

comments_2.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yangj1e>@yangj1e</denchmark-link>
 , the warning should be gone. If you still have an issue, that's something else. Let me know.

comments_3.comment_text:
Thanks, the warning has gone. But unfortunately, I am still having trouble with the server.
 I am using aws g2.2xlarge Ubuntu 14.04 and I use anaconda instead of system python. It used to work fine.

comments_4.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/lukeyeager>@lukeyeager</denchmark-link>
  It seems that if I manually create the  file, the server can start normally, otherwise, it would get stuck.

comments_5.comment_text:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/yangj1e>@yangj1e</denchmark-link>
 ,  won't work without a valid configuration file. But  should prompt you to provide any missing information. Let me know if that's not the behavior that you're seeing.
